SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.misc
Class Messenger

java.lang.Object
  evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.misc.Messenger

public class Messenger
extends java.lang.Object

The Messenger class implements the APEX messenger API. The commands initMsg(...) and writeMsg(...) are replicas of their C++ counterpart located in util - util_api and documented heavily in the header files of util - inc/messenger_inc.

Used to generate messages for printing to screen, file, or someplace else.

To initialize a global messenger, call the initMsg static method. To write a message to the global messenger, call the writeMsg static method.

Author:
hank

          This writes out a message.
static void writeMsg(int bitcode, java.lang.String message)
          The bitcode has the following components:

1-7 Level (ALWAYS_PRINT, TIER_1, TIER_2,...)
8,9 Severity (SEV_WARNING, ...)
10,11 Problem status (PS_NONE, PS_UNKNOWN,...)
11,12 data quality (DQ_GOOD, ...)
13-21 event (EVT_DATA, ...)

Pass in the bitcode as a sum of static constants in this class and then specify the message.

Method Detail

initMsg

public static void initMsg(int numevents,
                           java.lang.String[] eventnames,
                           java.lang.String filename,
                           int[] reqdlevels)
Initializes the GLOBAL_MSG object for messaging.

Define your own events and pass them into the constructor. Also takes filename and the levels required to result in a print for each event (0 means no printing, ALWAYS_PRINT means only ALWAYS_PRINT messages are printed, TIER_1 means ALWAYS_PRINT and TIER_1 messages are printed, etc...).

Parameters:
numevents -
eventnames -
filename -
reqdlevels -

writeMsg

public static void writeMsg(int bitcode,
                            java.lang.String message)
The bitcode has the following components:

1-7 Level (ALWAYS_PRINT, TIER_1, TIER_2,...)
8,9 Severity (SEV_WARNING, ...)
10,11 Problem status (PS_NONE, PS_UNKNOWN,...)
11,12 data quality (DQ_GOOD, ...)
13-21 event (EVT_DATA, ...)

Pass in the bitcode as a sum of static constants in this class and then specify the message. A \n should be included if a carriage return is to be included when it is printed to a file or screen.

Parameters:
bitcode - Sum of constants that define the error bit code.
message -

overrideRequiredLevels

public static void overrideRequiredLevels(int[] reqdlevels)
Overrides the default required levels with new ones.

Parameters:
reqdlevels -

finalize

protected void finalize()
Overrides:
finalize in class java.lang.Object

openFile

public void openFile()

writeMessage

public void writeMessage(int msgevent,
                         int severity,
                         int level,
                         int problemstatus,
                         int dataqual,
                         java.lang.String message)
This writes out a message. The format and structure exactly follow the C/C++ version given in Messenger.cxx (util -- util_api).

Parameters:
msgevent - Event -- EVT_DATA, for example
severity - SEV_WARNING, SEV_ERROR, SEV_INFO, or SEV_DEBUG
level - TIER_1, ALWAYS_PRINT, etc (0-127).
problemstatus - PS_NONE, PS_CORRECT, PS_...
dataqual - DQ_GOOD, DQ_...
message - Message to print.

setReqdLevels

public void setReqdLevels(int[] reqdlevels)

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
